And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

⚠️ 2 days left to apply for #MindandLifeSRI2021!🌍Join us & explore how the union of contemplative traditions, indigenous wisdom & science can restore our #humanearthconnection & reignite our collective responsibility as stewards of our planetary future ⬇️
https://t.co/PzeONz8NPW

Trees🌳 that doesn't give up just to give us life

Plant more trees. Care for humanity
Helping nature, helps people

Laura Green Foundation- Safer the environment, healthier the life.

#lauragreenfoundation

tweets.text: 🐟Breeding brook lampreys! Matt from DWT was excited to spot these primitive, eel-like fish in the River Torridge! These fish are rarely seen and spend most of their lives in the stream bed as larva, before turning into adults and swimming upstream to spawn! #TRRP #WEG @EnvAgency https://t.co/sMZarGLmyg
@Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency It's really not that tricky is it? Poo in rivers = bad. Poo not in rivers = good. 🙄

Data from @EnvAgency. Raw sewage is discharged into our rivers routinely during dry weather. How about applying some pressure @AndyBurnhamGM Manchester’s rivers are hit hard by this practice. Where is the commitment to enhance river habitats and water quality @EmmaHowardBoyd? https://t.co/KkinZw9sc8

tweets.text:
We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating the cause & taking action to avoid any further fish deaths

Our thanks go to the fast-acting members of the public who reported this to us on 0800 80 70 60

urls.title: Event duration monitoring – lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.

tweets.text:
Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

For information on storm overflows and a link to the full data and a summary of the key statistics, read our blog post: https://t.co/51zRnT2fSi https://t.co/cLtFlAR7jt

Julia gets it, Hugo gets it.

What about those in charge of this sorry mess @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency? https://t.co/VdoFZZFjtm
@thecloudchild Hi, please report this to our Incident team on 0800 80 70 60, free contact number 24/7. Fish in distress or killed is reported to us. Kind regards Shelley

urls.title: Living Landscapes Assistant: River Derwent | Yorkshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: Are you self-motivated and able to manage your own time effectively whilst also able to work as part of a team? Do you have good knowledge of land management principals and a strong commitment to nature conservation? If the answer is ‘yes’, then we have an exciting opportunity for you.

tweets.text: We're recruiting! Our team is looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic person to help deliver a wide range of projects across the Derwent Catchment! For more information visit:  https://t.co/3SO2OzwIru Closing date: 12th April. @LDV_NNR @northyorkmoors @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife https://t.co/eUe9E2hjPH

urls.title: Contact Us - Envireau Water
urls.description: Are you after some advice for a water-based development? Unsure where to direct your call? Phone our Midlands office on 01332 871 882 or our North office 01748 889 268, and we will pass you through to correct team. We look forward to hearing from you!

tweets.text: @dbennett_ks @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency that's...erm...handy?

@AndyWoodturner @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Our water company posts their annual goals a week after they report their annual findings. Amazingly, over the past 22 years they’ve always matched up 100%. 🤦🏽
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Oh! Oh! I think I know this one! Is it...is it, fuck all?

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency One reason for privatisation was separate regulator
Seems that scrutiny and accountability like much else these days is just so much old hat, we've moved on🙄😢

@Feargal_Sharkey @HughJaeger @EnvAgency Could it be that they are privatised monopolies more interested in profits and their shareholders rather than being responsible custodians of critical non-commercial national infrastructure with environmental, public health and social implications?
